text: I certainly thought that mostly kids
would find this part seeing this
enjoyable but it's really cool because
the adults will clamor for a seat at the
bar just as like aggressively as kids
will and people say all the time
regardless of like their age I've never
seen Donuts be done this way we call him
our fat bottomed girls when they get
like this I was looking at what everyone
else was doing and doing a little bit of
traveling tasting what other people were
doing and I went to Johnson City I had
heard from a friend's uncle that lived
there that there was an Amish family
selling Amish gym outside of a food
trailer at their farmers market
it's like a family a father and like his
three daughters that were like mixing
and shaping and frying and serving these
doughnuts that were like that big it one
flavor it was a vanilla glaze and they
said that it was like a sourdough dough
but the dough itself just had this
wonderful like slightly tang flavor and
they weren't too sweet and they had a
line snakes through the entire parking
lot and so I just tried to like take
that and the simplicity of it and then
offer just a couple more flavors because
I didn't think in Asheville having one
flavor in an actual shop would go over
very well so the perfect doughnut here
on a given day it's uh it's a fairly
lean dough it's got a little bit of egg
a little bit of butter it's got half
milk and half water for the liquid it's
got a little sugar a little yeast salt
so we mix it the day before it goes in
these tubs that it comes out of in the
morning when I shape it we do a series
of book folds over it so it can spend
less time in the mixer it's a little
gentler on the dough I don't have a
sheet or anything so we weigh every
donut to give me
they weigh between 1.9 and 2 ounces we
cut them with a biscuit cutter because I
don't want holes we just fry the whole
doughnut this is just a bean can that we
had cut and a friend sharpen it so it's
just around looks like a biscuit we just
make a hole with our thumbs pull it and
go round and round they're all a little
bit different and then they go from here
into this proofing cabinet pull them out
we put them in the fryer they take like
a minute half to frown first side that a
minute on the second and then we glaze
them depending on with the orders and
fry them all to order I think it was
just seeing other people do it and like
having this other thing that was like
appearing in my brain that was different
than what other people were doing I just
I mean that's what it is right like you
get an idea from one person and then a
little bit of your own and who doesn't
love something like hot and fried and
little sweet almost like
chocolate-covered pretzels you know
people just want hopefully people just
want one more bite
